positive.review: Just absolutely fun with a dose of beautiful graphics and a difficulty that allows you to learn as fast as you want. I did enjoy the game a lot!!

get it on sale, most worth it out of the wrc games because of price. TURN YOURV VIDEO SETTINGS ALL THE WAY UP TRUST ME IT MAKES IT SO MUCH BETTER AND DOESN'T EXPLODE YOUR PC! i play on laptop btw and it runs really good.

definitely a fun game

I've played WRC 4, 5 and 6 prior to this, it has (obviously) better graphics compared to earlier games, the environment around the gravel track has vibrant colors specially when the sun is low in the sky and orange sunrays hit the car's metal, the reddish-brown ground and the green and yellow leaves on trees. Some tracks have colorful flowers around them which makes the driving experience pleasant. The dust effects are good. 

I'm primarily interested in arcade racing games instead of simulator games because I have a keyword only, no controller or steering wheel. I have already played all popular arcade racing games so I find WRC games to be as entertaining as a difficult arcade game when played at lower difficulty. A single mistake like driving into the not-so -alive spectators will lead to a penalty that will cause loss of number 1 spot. 

There are obvious flaws in the game. When the car goes into a bush the bush disappears immediately as if it was made of air instead of hard branches. 1 in 3 times the game opens in Windowed mode and only fix is to quit and relaunch. I counted six instances of the game crashing after I finished a race.

rally.

After putting almost 180 hours into the game I kind of feel obliged to write some sort of a review, even though the game is pretty much irrelevant nowadays. 

This game is pretty average when it comes to driving mechanics, but I do feel like it's not a bad thing. It is easy to pick up for newcomers to rally games. Driving is still fun even though it is not crazy difficult even on hardest settings possible.
There aren't many stages, so if you want to get 100% of the achievements you'll have to grind a lot and it gets kind of stale and boring. One part of multiplayer is down, so you have to import saves to 100% the game, but that's okay. You can still play it against other players.
One thing that I have to point out is how good sound design is. It really gets you immersed into the game. 
Overall, fun game, good for beginners, worth getting on sale.

Jumped into WRC 7 after grabbing it on sale and I actually had a blast charging down those narrow forest roads. The official WRC cars, locations and stages feel legit and the handling is rewarding once you dial it in. That said, the career mode is kinda shallow and the physics still wobble around in places‚Äîso if you‚Äôre not a die-hard rally fan you might find it rough going. For the price I paid, though, totally worth it.
Car go vroom vroom fast then co-driver says "Medium 3 right" but in actuality it felt like a "Square right" so off the cliff I go.
Just absolutely fun with a dose of beautiful graphics and a difficulty that allows you to learn as fast as you want. I did enjoy the game a lot!!

Game runs great and has fun career/quick play modes with many different tracks. 

Works well with the Logitech G920 steering wheel.

Unfortunately the multiplayer does not work good. The game essentially freezes as soon as you join someones game forcing you to ALT + F4 to exit the game. Besides that, this is a great single player rally car racing game that you can get on sale for $1.99

get it on sale, most worth it out of the wrc games because of price. TURN YOURV VIDEO SETTINGS ALL THE WAY UP TRUST ME IT MAKES IT SO MUCH BETTER AND DOESN'T EXPLODE YOUR PC! i play on laptop btw and it runs really good.

definitely a fun game

WRC 7: FIA World Rally Championship ‚Äî Review

WRC 7 is the kind of game that sits in a tricky place ‚Äî caught between realism and accessibility, between simulation and arcade. It‚Äôs not the flashiest racing game on the market, but it knows what it wants to be: a tough, gritty, and sometimes unforgiving rally experience that rewards precision and patience more than raw speed.

Developed by Kylotonn (KT Racing), WRC 7 came after a few rough years for the series, and it shows the studio starting to really find its rhythm. It‚Äôs not perfect, but it‚Äôs a big step toward a more authentic, satisfying rally experience.

Gameplay and Driving Feel

The heart of any rally game is the handling ‚Äî and WRC 7 feels pretty good once you get used to it. Cars are twitchy, powerful, and require constant control. Every surface ‚Äî gravel, asphalt, snow ‚Äî feels noticeably different.

The sense of speed is excellent. You can almost feel the car slide across loose dirt or grip tightly through narrow tarmac roads. Small mistakes have big consequences ‚Äî a late brake or slightly missed apex can send you off a cliff or into a tree.

That said, WRC 7 isn‚Äôt as finely tuned as something like DiRT Rally or Richard Burns Rally. The physics are solid but sometimes inconsistent; cars can feel light in certain conditions and oddly heavy in others. Still, for a mid-tier rally title, it‚Äôs surprisingly immersive once you find the rhythm.

The AI is decent and provides a fair challenge, and the game‚Äôs stages ‚Äî based on the 2017 FIA World Rally Championship ‚Äî are genuinely exciting. The course design is narrow and technical, often demanding total focus. Some stages are brutally tough, but that‚Äôs part of the appeal.

Game Modes and Content

WRC 7 offers a few main ways to play:

Career Mode, where you join a rally team, upgrade your car, and compete across the season. It‚Äôs straightforward but functional ‚Äî not as deep as it could be, but enough to keep you pushing for better times.

Quick Stage and Multiplayer, which let you jump straight into the action or race against others online or locally.

eSports WRC, which was an interesting addition for more competitive players.

The content covers all 13 official rallies from the 2017 season, with 52 stages total. The variety of locations ‚Äî from snowy Sweden to muddy Wales ‚Äî gives each rally a distinct feel.

The lack of deep customization might disappoint some, but the official cars and teams look great, and the variety in terrain and weather keeps it fresh.

Presentation

Visually, WRC 7 looks quite solid for its generation. The lighting and weather effects are well done ‚Äî rainstorms and sunset glare look beautiful in motion. Environments are detailed and atmospheric, especially when you‚Äôre tearing through them at full speed.

Performance is mostly stable, though occasional frame drops appear in heavy weather or on older systems. The cockpit views are immersive, and the audio design is a highlight ‚Äî engines roar convincingly, co-driver calls sound clear, and the crunch of gravel under tires feels real.

The user interface and menus are still a bit clunky, and the presentation overall feels more ‚Äúfunctional‚Äù than stylish. But once you‚Äôre on the road, it captures that rally intensity perfectly.

What I Liked

Strong sense of speed and control

Great stage design ‚Äî narrow, technical, and challenging

Solid official WRC atmosphere and authenticity

Weather effects and lighting look great

Improved physics over earlier WRC titles

What I Didn‚Äôt Like

Physics can be inconsistent at times

Career mode is shallow and repetitive

Limited car customization

Menus and UI feel dated

Occasional technical hiccups

Final Thoughts

WRC 7 may not have the polish of DiRT Rally 2.0 or the deep simulation of Richard Burns Rally, but it has something those games sometimes lack ‚Äî a distinct rally soul. It‚Äôs demanding, gritty, and often frustrating, but when it all clicks ‚Äî when you slide perfectly through a corner with your co-driver shouting in your ear ‚Äî it‚Äôs pure adrenaline.

It‚Äôs a clear improvement over the earlier WRC entries and laid the groundwork for Kylotonn‚Äôs much stronger later games (WRC 8, 9, and 10). For fans of rally racing, it‚Äôs definitely worth a spin, especially if you enjoy mastering narrow, punishing stages where one mistake can cost everything.

My Score: 7.5/10
A tough, rewarding rally experience ‚Äî imperfect but passionate, with just enough bite to keep you coming back.

Good game, currently don't have a gaming pc but this game runs perfectly on my school Latitude 2 in 1. Me and my brother spend alot of time in the split screen. Recommend using xbox controllers for split screen. But overall a great game!!!

This is a big step forward for the series. Previous entries, like WRC 5, felt forgiving, but this game features noticeably narrower stage designs and more realistic car handling. While the cars are hard to control initially, the demanding learning curve is precisely what makes the game rewarding. For a 2017 title, the graphics still look surprisingly detailed and impressive. WRC 7 is a masterpiece.
A great game,very technical on its driving experience,you can't just drive like a madman or you gonna be punished. But a very chill casual friendly game.

Pleased with physics in this game. Driving feels thrilling and easy. Can you make next time 2 separate games - one simulator like your WRC Generations and second one something like this one? I will continue playing your games, but 7th is one of the greatest so far.

I've played WRC 4, 5 and 6 prior to this, it has (obviously) better graphics compared to earlier games, the environment around the gravel track has vibrant colors specially when the sun is low in the sky and orange sunrays hit the car's metal, the reddish-brown ground and the green and yellow leaves on trees. Some tracks have colorful flowers around them which makes the driving experience pleasant. The dust effects are good. 

I'm primarily interested in arcade racing games instead of simulator games because I have a keyword only, no controller or steering wheel. I have already played all popular arcade racing games so I find WRC games to be as entertaining as a difficult arcade game when played at lower difficulty. A single mistake like driving into the not-so -alive spectators will lead to a penalty that will cause loss of number 1 spot. 

There are obvious flaws in the game. When the car goes into a bush the bush disappears immediately as if it was made of air instead of hard branches. 1 in 3 times the game opens in Windowed mode and only fix is to quit and relaunch. I counted six instances of the game crashing after I finished a race.

What i like:

WRC 7 has improved a lot on the physics and handling. The cars actually feel heavy and real. You can feel the difference between driving on gravel, snow, or tarmac, which makes it feel more like real rally racing.

Cars and tracks look nice, and you can see dirt and mud build up on your car. Engine sounds and the environment feel realistic too.

The stages are varied and challenging. Some ‚ÄúEpic‚Äù stages are long and really test your driving skills, so it keeps things interesting.



What I don't: 

Career mode is kind of boring. You move up through the ranks, but it‚Äôs repetitive. There‚Äôs not much story or anything exciting to keep you hooked.

You can‚Äôt save different car setups for stages, which is annoying if you like tweaking your car for each race.

It's not a huge visual upgrade. The graphics are nice, but compared to the previous game, WRC 7 doesn‚Äôt feel like a big step up.



So yeah, WRC 7 is fun if you like rally games, the driving feels real, the tracks are cool, and it looks and sounds good... But don‚Äôt expect a super deep career mode or tons of car customization. It‚Äôs solid, but a bit basic in some areas.
Liked the sim. Great graphics. A little more variety of tracks would be nice. Otherwise, fantastic.

PS4 controller is not working properly with the game. Third person is stuck viewing the left side of the car, so you can't see where you are going. It's the first game I've encountered where ds4Windows does not help at all.

Going to refund the game as it's unplayable for me.

This game used to work with my G923 wheel & pedals, not now for some reason. I had 40hours up in this game.  Nothing changed but now it said device didconnected but the buttons on the wheel work through the menu ok.
BTW the wheel work in all the other games !!!!

I think I buy every WRC game to make a saga of ****** reviews. I really enjoy it. Until I reach the best one or better than WRC9. This is gonna be a long fun fun journey! Leeets go :)

After playing 9th and 6th (in this order sadly (....), I am in 7th and they have unimproved a couple issues from WRC 6 xD
I didnt expect that!
Cars are now way way more oversteering (means they over-react to slight maneuvre of your steer button interaction) than in previous game. Especially on gravel rocky surface - feels like on ice.  On hard tarmac driving feels pretty good and clean.
Camera setting do the same job what in 6th WRC each view affect car traction and handling differently. Nice.
What is even better the weird "camera effect" as you reach higher speed car is moving away from your monitor. Like pressing nitrous button in NFS. But it is not NfS here... Bruh literally, in NFS 2015, Heat, even Unbound, your rides have better driving mechanics. 

The next familiar thing- my graphics are on max, every single one option 'on' and it looks worse than not launching them on "maxed out". Cool.

Sounds are better here, the real, somehow they recorded them very well. Feel the engines have that power and grit. Good.

In WRC 6 only on snowy rallies frame drop happens a lot. On all the other roads performance is good. Here is funny, with shadows on max I reach more FPS, than having them completely off. This is ingenous! While in WRC 6 i had different situation - set shadows on low , made the game look better. Didn't I told you this is gonna be a fun? :)
 
Heard from my buddy that this game stutters a lot, it's true, in 1080p stutters a lot and frames are dropping. But funnier, keeping post process setup on maximum gives you more frames than turning them off (reflections, SSAO, bloom etc). Bruh, just hire these devs into Cod or BF, asap! I repeat asap!

Game is playable and stable when you drop the resolution to 1600x900 from 1920 x 1080 but sadly it loses quality a lot and will look like shit. Almost I rated this up but somehow WRC 9 runs great and its newer.

Okay, so what is good in this part of WRC?  xd

+ The terrain of tracks and physics effect are nicer. I was expecting this tbh. 
+Ofcourse the sounds of engine and environment.
+ Car details are even more well-designed. No jokes ,they looking great. 
+ The best part about WRC7 for me is new additions to environmental objects like windfans, more real tracks surface and changing roads or views. 
+ Tracks aren't much like a copy and paste from each one to another. Yeaa this is better. But it is not better than WRC9, so far
Alright,
thank you for reading if you made it by the way, now time to move onto WRC 8

(it even rhymes wtf)

This game used to work with my G923 wheel & pedals, not now for some reason. I had 40hours up in this game.  Nothing changed but now it said device didconnected but the buttons on the wheel work through the menu ok.
BTW the wheel work in all the other games !!!!
8 year old game on my new pretty good spec laptop couldn't run above 15fps 2/10
the worst game i ever playd on a steering wheel. you can't even set the controlls. fuck this game
Honestley, meh. I hoped for more when carrying the WRC title.

Wow, it runs ok!
But looks and handles like "P**"
I tried connecting my Logitech G923 but I can only connect the wheel or the throttle can't connect both for some reason
unplayable on controller
there is no like actual multiplayer
accomplishments don't work
Stuttering mess

PS4 controller is not working properly with the game. Third person is stuck viewing the left side of the car, so you can't see where you are going. It's the first game I've encountered where ds4Windows does not help at all.

Going to refund the game as it's unplayable for me.

I think I buy every WRC game to make a saga of ****** reviews. I really enjoy it. Until I reach the best one or better than WRC9. This is gonna be a long fun fun journey! Leeets go :)

After playing 9th and 6th (in this order sadly (....), I am in 7th and they have unimproved a couple issues from WRC 6 xD
I didnt expect that!
Cars are now way way more oversteering (means they over-react to slight maneuvre of your steer button interaction) than in previous game. Especially on gravel rocky surface - feels like on ice.  On hard tarmac driving feels pretty good and clean.
Camera setting do the same job what in 6th WRC each view affect car traction and handling differently. Nice.
What is even better the weird "camera effect" as you reach higher speed car is moving away from your monitor. Like pressing nitrous button in NFS. But it is not NfS here... Bruh literally, in NFS 2015, Heat, even Unbound, your rides have better driving mechanics. 

The next familiar thing- my graphics are on max, every single one option 'on' and it looks worse than not launching them on "maxed out". Cool.

Sounds are better here, the real, somehow they recorded them very well. Feel the engines have that power and grit. Good.

In WRC 6 only on snowy rallies frame drop happens a lot. On all the other roads performance is good. Here is funny, with shadows on max I reach more FPS, than having them completely off. This is ingenous! While in WRC 6 i had different situation - set shadows on low , made the game look better. Didn't I told you this is gonna be a fun? :)
 
Heard from my buddy that this game stutters a lot, it's true, in 1080p stutters a lot and frames are dropping. But funnier, keeping post process setup on maximum gives you more frames than turning them off (reflections, SSAO, bloom etc). Bruh, just hire these devs into Cod or BF, asap! I repeat asap!

Game is playable and stable when you drop the resolution to 1600x900 from 1920 x 1080 but sadly it loses quality a lot and will look like shit. Almost I rated this up but somehow WRC 9 runs great and its newer.
